Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2013 04:55PM CJKLOSE wrote: Hi ladies. I haven't been online for a while so trying to play catch up. I was supposed to have my BMX yesterday, but it has rescheduled to Dec 12th. I was cutting back my rose bushes and got scratched up by one of them...the rose won the fight. I ended up with a nasty fungal infection on that arm so they won't do the surgery til it is healed. I certainly understand why they must wait...but a bit bummed cause I wanted to get over the worst before Christmas...I love Christmas. Oh well, huh? I wish all Nov ladies the very best with surgeries and recuperation.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2013 12:47PM CJKLOSE wrote: Hi all. My surgery has been postponed from Nov 13th to Dec 12th due to a fungal infection I got from pruning a rose bush (the rose bush won). They have put me on meds and sent me to a wound center for procedures I am to follow for the infection it left on my right arm. After 3 lumpectomies, one of which I got an infection; and now, this fungal thingy causing my surgery to move out for another month...this is getting a bit old and getting bummed out a bit. I have a question and probably a dumb one. Will I have a catheter before, during and after the surgery? I know I didn't for the lumpectomies because they were only a couple hours of surgery...but this surgery for a double MX and the beginnings of reconstruction they say will be 8-9 hours. The lumpectomies were my first surgery ever, so I'm not sure what to expect with such a long surgery. So that is why my question about the catheter...will I have one and will they remove it before I wake up (hope so). Thanks ladies and I am so glad to have friends through all of this. CJ
